config.prompt: We are going to do a detailed build floor by floor of Castle Blood Forge. You are going to ensure consistency and dimensional alignment. The overview of each floor is below, I need you to start with the first floor of the castle at ground level. Overall footprint Outer walls: about 1,040 ft (east‚Äìwest) by 840 ft (north‚Äìsouth). Enclosed area: roughly 874,000 sq ft, just over 20 acres inside the walls. This comfortably holds multiple large internal wings, courtyards, and yards. Curtain walls East wall: 1,040 ft long, 70 ft high (taller for sunrise shade). West wall: 1,040 ft long, 45 ft high (mountains already give shade). North wall: 840 ft long, 45 ft high. South wall: 840 ft long, 60 ft high (coastal, sun and siege facing). You can picture the walls forming a big, slightly elongated rectangle. Think of the inside divided loosely into three east‚Äìwest bands: north ward, central ward, south/industrial ward. Central keep base: about 360 ft (east‚Äìwest) by 300 ft (north‚Äìsouth). It sits roughly in the middle of the castle, leaving wide courtyards on all sides. Central spire rises from its West Side, protruding about halfway from west wall of the keep,120+ ft tall. South Industrial / Forge Zone (above the underground blood forge) Massive chimneys, hoists, and winch houses sit here, aligned vertically with the Bloodforge beneath. Southeast Outer Ward (gates, stables, wagons) Outer ward: about 300 ft (east‚Äìwest) by 240 ft (north‚Äìsouth) in the southeast corner, just inside the main gate. Holds stables for 60‚Äì80 horses, wagon sheds, smithy for mundane repairs, and a mustering yard. This ward nestles between the south wall, east wall, and the service wing; it does not encroach on the central keep‚Äôs space. North Ward (administration and quieter areas) The northern band of the castle, between the north curtain wall and the central keep, is mostly 200‚Äì250 ft deep. Vertical structure Ground level: courtyards, barracks, stables, service halls, main halls of the keep. First and second floors of the keep: great hall, feast chambers, council rooms, noble and vampire apartments. Third floor and spires: private sanctums, laboratories, and secure chambers. Below: castle storage, then the Bloodforge storage level, then the Bloodforge itself, then the mining line.

progress.prompt:
You are creating a D&D location. This is stage 2/5: Foundation.

You are building upon the Purpose stage which determined the scale and type.

Your task is to establish the structural foundation appropriate to the location's scale.

FOR SIMPLE/MODERATE LOCATIONS (taverns, shops, small dungeons):
Focus on these fields:
- layout: Object describing overall arrangement
  {
    description: "Overall layout description",
    dimensions: { length: "60 ft", width: "40 ft", height: "15 ft" } (if applicable),
    levels: Array of level descriptions (e.g., ["main floor", "cellar", "upstairs rooms"])
  }
- spatial_organization: How spaces relate to each other (e.g., "main room with kitchen in back, stairs to rooms above")
- access_points: Entrances/exits

FOR COMPLEX/MASSIVE LOCATIONS (castles, cities, mega-dungeons):
Add advanced structural fields:
- wings: Array of major sections (if applicable)
- floors: Detailed floor structure with elevations
- locking_points: Fixed structural anchors for geometry validation
- load_bearing_walls: Critical structural elements
- vertical_connections: Stairs, ramps, lifts
- constraints: Binding rules for space generation

METADATA LINKING SYSTEM (ALL SCALES):
- chunk_mesh_metadata: Object for seamless chunk integration (REQUIRED)
  {
    connection_protocol: "How chunks connect" (e.g., "doors", "hallways", "adjacency"),
    boundary_markers: Array of connection points for other chunks,
    spatial_hierarchy: "How chunks nest" (e.g., "floor > wing > room" or "area > sub-area > feature"),
    coordinate_system: "Coordinate reference" (e.g., "relative", "absolute grid", "narrative only")
  }

This metadata ensures chunks mesh perfectly when generated iteratively.

Return ONLY a JSON object with the specified fields. No markdown, no explanation.

---

You are creating a D&D location. This is stage 3/5: Spaces (Iterative Generation).

You are generating individual spaces (rooms, areas, chambers) one at a time.

METADATA LINKING FOR PERFECT MESHING:
Each space you generate MUST include linking metadata to mesh perfectly with other chunks:
- chunk_id: Unique identifier for this space chunk
- mesh_anchors: Object describing connection points
  {
    connects_to: Array of space IDs this connects to (or "pending" for future chunks),
    connection_types: Array of connection methods (e.g., "door", "hallway", "stairs", "open"),
    boundary_interface: Precise description of where this chunk meets others,
    spatial_relationship: How this chunk fits in the hierarchy (e.g., "ground_floor.main_hall.alcove")
  }

REQUIRED FIELDS FOR ALL SPACES:

1. BASIC INFO:
- id: Unique identifier
- name: Space name
- purpose: Primary function
- description: Brief narrative description (2-3 sentences)

2. DIMENSIONS:
- dimensions: { width: number, height: number, unit: "ft" }
- floor_height: number (ceiling height in feet)

3. VISUAL DATA (for map rendering):
- floor: { material: "stone"|"wood"|"dirt"|"tile", color: "#hexcode" }
- walls: Array of wall segments
  [
    {
      side: "north"|"south"|"east"|"west",
      material: "stone"|"wood"|"brick",
      color: "#hexcode",
      thickness: number (feet)
    }
  ]
- doors: Array of door/opening objects
  [
    {
      wall: "north"|"south"|"east"|"west",
      position: number (0.0-1.0, percentage along wall),
      width: number (feet),
      style: "wooden"|"iron"|"archway"|"portcullis",
      leads_to: "Space Name or Pending",
      color: "#hexcode"
    }
  ]
- features: Array of interior features
  [
    {
      type: "furniture"|"architectural"|"fixture",
      label: "Descriptive name",
      position: { x: number, y: number } (coordinates in feet from NW corner),
      shape: "rectangle"|"circle"|"polygon",
      width: number, height: number (or radius for circles),
      color: "#hexcode",
      material: "wood"|"stone"|"metal"|"cloth"
    }
  ]

4. LIGHTING & ATMOSPHERE:
- lighting: "torch"|"natural"|"magical"|"dark"
- ambient_color: "#hexcode" (overall tint)

EXAMPLE OUTPUT:
{
  "id": "courtyard_south_1",
  "name": "Barracks Courtyard (South Ward)",
  "purpose": "Training and mustering area",
  "description": "An open courtyard paved with weathered cobblestones...",
  "dimensions": { "width": 60, "height": 40, "unit": "ft" },
  "floor_height": 20,
  "floor": { "material": "stone", "color": "#8B7D6B" },
  "walls": [
    { "side": "north", "material": "stone", "color": "#6B6B6B", "thickness": 3 },
    { "side": "south", "material": "stone", "color": "#6B6B6B", "thickness": 3 }
  ],
  "doors": [
    { "wall": "north", "position": 0.3, "width": 5, "style": "wooden", "leads_to": "Inner Ward Passage", "color": "#8B4513" }
  ],
  "features": [
    { "type": "architectural", "label": "Central Well", "position": {"x": 30, "y": 20}, "shape": "circle", "radius": 3, "color": "#4A4A4A", "material": "stone" },
    { "type": "fixture", "label": "Fire Pit", "position": {"x": 30, "y": 35}, "shape": "circle", "radius": 4, "color": "#8B0000", "material": "stone" }
  ],
  "lighting": "natural",
  "ambient_color": "#F5F5DC"
}

CONFLICT DETECTION:
If you detect issues (overlaps, impossible connections, dimension conflicts), add a proposal:
{
  question: "Describe the specific conflict",
  options: ["Solution 1", "Solution 2", "Solution 3", "Custom"],
  rule_impact: "What constraint is violated",
  field_path: "geometry.dimensions",
  severity: "blocking" | "warning"
}

Return ONLY a JSON object with the space fields PLUS mesh_anchors and (if conflicts) proposals[].
No markdown, no explanation.

---

purpose.name: Castle Blood Forge
purpose.description: A massive, sprawling fortress spanning over 20 acres, defined by tall, varying curtain walls and a huge central keep with a spire. It functions as a heavily militarized command center and a dark industrial complex, built around the unseen Bloodforge underground.
purpose.purpose: Fortress, military command center, arcane industrial complex, and residence of Lady Erliza the Bloodsmith.
purpose.setting: The highly fortified seat of power for Lady Erliza, Bloodsmith, in a region where sun exposure and siege defense are key concerns.
key_features: Massive Curtain Walls with varying heights (45 ft to 70 ft) based on tactical need.
A large, central Keep (360 ft x 300 ft) with a 120+ ft Central Spire.
A segregated South Industrial/Forge Zone featuring hoists and winch houses.
The Southeast Outer Ward for logistics (stables, mundane smithy, mustering yard).
Extensive subterranean levels including the Bloodforge itself.

floors.purpose: Primary access, service, military staging, industrial alignment.
key_areas: Stables and Mustering Yard (Southeast Outer Ward)
Industrial Hoists and Winch Houses (South Zone)

floors.purpose: Arcane components, blood-related supplies, raw bloodsteel.
Primary industrial and ritual site for construct creation.

locking_points.center_keep: Absolute center of castle: 520 ft East, 420 ft North.
locking_points.main_gate: Centered on the East wall (1040 ft long), approximately 520 ft from North corner.
locking_points.forge_vertical_shaft: Aligned with South Industrial Zone chimneys.

vertical_connections: Winch-operated Lifts/Hoists (South Industrial Zone, connecting to Bloodforge)
Spiral Stairs (Central Spire, connecting Keep floors 1-3)
constraints: All structures within the 1040 ft E-W by 840 ft N-S curtain wall boundary.
The South Industrial Zone must have clear vertical access to the underground Bloodforge levels.
The Central Keep must be surrounded by courtyard space on all four sides.

chunk_mesh_metadata.connection_protocol: Doors, Archways, and Wide Hallways for inter-wing travel; Grids for courtyard movement.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large, irregular yard located in the southeast corner, dedicated to logistical and gate operations.

spaces.name: Southeast Mustering Yard
spaces.purpose: Staging area for patrols, wagon traffic, and overflow barracks mustering. The main outer ward space.
spaces.description: This yard is a mix of packed dirt and loose cobblestones, showing heavy use by wagons and mounted troops. It is enclosed by the tall eastern curtain wall and several low-slung stable and shed buildings. The air is dominated by the smell of horses, leather, and manure, a common sound of mundane castle life.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large, irregular yard located in the southeast corner, dedicated to logistical and gate operations.

proposals.question: A space named "Southeast Mustering Yard" already exists. Duplicate names will cause confusion. How should we resolve this?

details.materials: The outer curtain walls and the core of the Central Keep are constructed from massive blocks of **dark, heavily reinforced basalt** quarried from the nearby mountains. Interior service structures (barracks, stables) use a mix of **grey granite** and **rough-sawn, blood-red stained oak**. Arcane and industrial areas feature extensive use of **riveted black iron**, **blood-steel ingots**, and smooth, dark **marble** for ritual surfaces.
details.lighting_scheme: Exterior courtyards rely on **natural light** during the day, which is often harsh and necessitates the high eastern wall. Interior spaces primarily use **magical blood-braziers** emitting a deep, throbbing crimson glow, supplemented by iron-cased **oil lanterns** in service areas, and nearly **total darkness** in the deep storage and vampire residential zones.
details.atmosphere: Castle Blood Forge feels overwhelmingly **heavy, cold, and oppressive**. The massive scale is dehumanizing, and the dark stone absorbs all natural light, casting long, unnatural shadows. A constant, low-frequency **thrumming** emanates from the industrial south and below ground, often carrying a faint, metallic odor of **blood and ozone**, reminding all inhabitants of the castle's true, dark purpose.

notable_npcs.name: Commander Varkos
notable_npcs.location: North Ward Barracks/Central Keep Main Hall

encounter_areas.description: A sudden ambush of guards and war-dogs when the party crosses the wide, open eastern courtyard.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Extremely exposed space. Guards (Ranged) will utilize the statues for cover. No cover for players. Use the long approach path to force a drawn-out charge or a retreat to the gatehouse/keep door.

encounter_areas.description: The central winch machinery jams, or a specific piece of equipment must be lowered/raised to proceed, requiring coordination and knowledge of the winch controls.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: The winch shaft (Radius 5ft) is a deadly environmental hazard. Requires an Intelligence or Strength (Athletics) check to operate under pressure, perhaps while being harassed by a small Blood Golem.

encounter_areas.description: A squad of Blood-Bound Guard is arming themselves in the armory before their patrol rotation.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Tight quarters, disadvantage for large weapons. Racks of weapons offer partial cover (AC +2). Focus fire on the guard operating the stairs access to prevent reinforcements from the wall walk.

secrets.description: A pressure plate hidden beneath a stack of 'rejected' ingots opens a stone chute leading down to Sub-Level 2 (Bloodforge Storage).
secrets.how_to_find: DC 17 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the slightly uneven floor tile beneath the stack; DC 15 Strength (Athletics) to move the heavy ingots.

secrets.description: A loose floorboard on the muster scaffold hides a signet ring and a coded message from a previous spy.
secrets.how_to_find: DC 14 Investigation check on the scaffold while guards are distracted or DC 12 check if the area is empty.

secrets.description: A loose floorboard on the muster scaffold hides a signet ring and a coded message from a previous spy.
secrets.how_to_find: DC 14 Investigation check on the scaffold while guards are distracted or DC 12 check if the area is empty.

details.history:
Castle Blood Forge was not built over centuries like most fortresses; it was raised in a single decade by Lady Erliza's magically accelerated labor force. Its unique, imposing architecture is a testament to her ruthless efficiency and dark magical power. The fortress was designed not to resist the siege engines of men, but to repel the divine light of the sun and contain the volatile alchemical and ritual processes happening beneath its foundations. It is often said that every stone laid was sealed with a drop of blood.

The original structure stood on the ruins of an ancient dwarven mine that Erliza co-opted for its rich iron veins. When she discovered the peculiar, sanguine qualities of the subterranean water and ore, the castle's purpose shifted. It became the seat of her new empire, dedicated to forging Blood-Steel and creating her terrible constructs. The towers and curtain walls serve as a massive, dark shell shielding the industrial core and the sensitive workings of the Bloodforge from prying eyes and the purifying sunlight.
details.current_events: A massive, experimental construct‚ÄîThe **Iron Behemoth**‚Äîis currently being assembled on the lowest levels of the Bloodforge. The industrial zone on the surface is working at triple capacity, causing frequent accidents and the erratic, loud operation of the winches (CBSF-G-SW06). Commander Varkos is pushing his guards harder than ever, readying for an unknown, imminent deployment or invasion. Rumors of a **critical component** needed for the Behemoth's completion‚Äîperhaps a holy relic or a specific living sacrifice‚Äîare circulating among the thralls and guards.
adventure_hooks: The party is tasked by a local resistance group to disable the **Bloodforge Winch House (CBSF-G-SW06)**, cutting off the supply of ritual components to the underground levels.
A spy was recently caught leaving a coded message in the **Southeast Mustering Yard (CBSF-G-SE01)**. The party must infiltrate the yard, retrieve the code, and escape before the next patrol.

Lady Erliza requires the specific raw material contained in the **Processed Goods Storage (CBSF-G-SW09)** for the Iron Behemoth. A rival faction hires the party to steal the Blood-Steel Ingots before they can be used.

special_features: **Blood-Steel Construction:** Many doors and fixtures are made of Blood-Steel, which is resistant to radiant damage and dampens divine magic (imposing disadvantage on certain holy spells cast against the object).

**The Keep's Shadow:** The Central Keep is enchanted to project an unnatural gloom, causing all areas within 50 feet of its base (including the East Courtyard, CBSF-G-CE01) to count as dim light, even under direct sun.

**Winch Resonance:** The massive winch in CBSF-G-SW06 creates a low, resonant magical field. Creatures attempting to cast or maintain concentration on a spell within 20 feet of the main shaft have disadvantage on their concentration checks.

details.cinematic_walkthrough:
The entry begins at the massive, shadowed **East Gatehouse**, guarded by grim-faced, iron-clad soldiers. Once through, the party steps onto the enormous **Main East Courtyard (CBSF-G-CE01)**. The space is vast and chilling, paved in dark basalt that drinks the light, making the clear day feel overcast. The sheer mass of the Keep dominates the western horizon, its towering stone face and spire an impossible feat of construction that seems to watch every step.

Moving south, the atmosphere abruptly shifts as you enter the busy, chaotic **Southeast Mustering Yard (CBSF-G-SE01)**. Here, the grim military aesthetic gives way to logistical grime. The loud whinnying of horses and the shouts of thralls hauling supplies replace the silence of the courtyard. Dust and manure coat the ground, and the immense eastern wall looms, its 70-foot height cutting off the sunrise. The party observes soldiers inspecting wagons near the tethering posts and a sergeant drilling new recruits on the wooden scaffold.

Venturing into the South Industrial Ward, the air grows thick with heat and the metallic tang of the Bloodforge. The **Winch House (CBSF-G-SW06)** is a terrifying sight: a soaring chamber where massive iron gears grind, turning a central spool that lowers colossal buckets into the earth. The whole building vibrates with the noise, and the deep red glow of the magical lighting makes the metallic blood smell feel palpable. The journey culminates as you press through the narrow **West Industrial Corridor (CBSF-G-SW07)**, eventually reaching the **Industrial Loading Yard (CBSF-G-SW08)**, where hoists and cranes stand ready, silhouetted against the western curtain wall, awaiting the next shipment of Blood-Steel from the depths.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Connects the main gatehouse to the Southeast Outer Ward (via the South wall) and the Main Courtyard/Keep Approach (via the West wall).

accumulatedChunkResults.name: East Grand Courtyard (East Gate Approach)
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary external access, ceremonial entry, and main approach to the Central Keep.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This massive, rectangular courtyard is dominated by the tall, intimidating East Curtain Wall, which casts long shadows even during the day. The ground is packed dirt and dark, crushed stone, constantly churning from military and industrial traffic.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Southeast Outer Ward (Mustering Yard)
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary staging area for traffic, stable access, and general mustering point for troops and wagon trains.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A vast, rough courtyard covering 300 ft by 240 ft in the southeast corner of the castle. The ground is hard-packed dirt and gravel, constantly churned by wagon wheels and horse hooves. It is bordered by the East and South curtain walls, the Gatehouse, and the low-slung service buildings.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Fills the Southeast corner (300ft E-W, 240ft N-S). Eastern edge connects to the Gatehouse (CBF-L1-001). Western edge connects to the main artery (CBF-L1-006). The North and South boundaries meet the Stables and Sheds.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: East Wall Guard Tower Base
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary staging area and armory for guards covering the East Curtain Wall and controlling the gate mechanisms.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A cramped, hexagonal chamber at the base of the nearest inner tower, built into the 70ft wall. It contains weapon racks and a simple winch mechanism for raising the gate's secondary portcullis. The air here is stale and dusty, filled with the scent of oil and iron.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Located just north of the Gatehouse (CBF-L1-001), accessed by stairs from that chamber. The northern door leads into the inner wall structure and the stairs for the Wall Walk/Towers.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Southeast Stables and Blacksmith Annex
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housing for warhorses and draft animals, and mundane repair smithy.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A long, single-story structure running along the southern edge of the Outer Ward, featuring dozens of heavy timber stalls capable of holding 60-80 horses. The attached annex houses a constantly working, heat-stained smithy for general repairs and shoeing.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Located south of the Outer Ward (CBF-L1-002), running parallel to the South Curtain Wall. Connects to the yard via an archway/opening on the north face.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Wagon Shed and Siege Equipment Bay
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Storage and maintenance area for transport wagons and heavy siege equipment.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A long, open-fronted shed with a heavy timber frame and dirt floor. It is currently filled with heavy transport carts and two large, ominously quiet siege engines covered in tarpaulins. The area is dominated by the smell of oiled wood and coal dust.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Located along the north edge of the Outer Ward (CBF-L1-002). Opens south onto the yard. The east wall is shared with a section of the inner curtain wall structure, leading to the Barracks (CBF-L1-011).

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Inner South Ward Passage (Main Artery)
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary, high-traffic arterial road connecting the Outer Ward to the Central Keep and the industrial areas.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A very wide, straight, stone-paved road that runs west from the Outer Ward, serving as the main ground-level thoroughfare. The passage is bordered by the low service buildings of the Southeast Ward and the heavier construction of the Barracks and Industrial Zone.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The main road running West from the Outer Ward (CBF-L1-002). Connects the outer area to the Forge Zone (North) and Barracks (South), terminating at the Keep Approach (West).

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Courtyard (South Ward)
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Training, drill, and leisure area for the castle's mortal garrison.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A square, open yard paved with rough, dark cobblestones. This area is enclosed by the Barracks buildings and is perpetually noisy with the shouts of training soldiers and the clatter of weaponry. A large, worn circular stone dais sits near the center, used by commanders to oversee drills.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Located directly south of the Inner South Ward Passage (CBF-L1-006). Serves as the central hub for the Barracks buildings which surround it on three sides.
Central hub of the entire castle, connecting the four main courtyards to the interior of the Central Keep and the main staircase.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Central Keep Entrance Hall
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary defensive, ceremonial, and distributional hub of the Keep.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A vast, cold hall built of basalt and dark marble, featuring soaring 40-foot ceilings. Four massive arches open onto the exterior courtyards. The air is heavy and perpetually dim, lit by flickering iron-caged torches.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Connects the main ground level entrance hall (K01) to the upper levels of the keep via a wide, central staircase.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Grand Stairwell Chamber
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary vertical transport for the Central Keep, leading to residential and noble areas.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A high, narrow chamber that houses the massive, U-shaped grand staircase. The stairs themselves are made of smooth, dark wood inlaid with faint, crimson-glowing metallic veins. Caged torches provide the only light, casting long, distorted shadows on the stone walls.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Southeast corner utility ward, bordered by the East Curtain Wall (East), South Curtain Wall (South), and the Industrial Wing (West/Northwest).

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Southeast Mustering Yard & Stables Approach
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Logistics hub, staging ground for mounted troops, and area for non-arcane repair.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A large, contained open space featuring stables, repair sheds, and a dirt-and-gravel yard for mustering troops and moving supplies. It is notably grimier and louder than the main courtyard, dominated by the smell of horses and hot iron.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Forms the central entryway and corridor for the North Ward, connecting the barracks and administrative areas to the Northern Courtyard.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: North Ward Main Corridor
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Internal movement artery, primary access to barracks and administrative offices.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A long, dimly lit corridor running parallel to the north wall, smelling faintly of stale sweat and lamp oil. The stone walls are heavily scarred and lined with large, simple wooden doors leading into the barracks rooms. This corridor is designed for efficient, large-scale troop movement.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A common use area situated just off the main North Ward corridor, serving as a day room and light administrative space for the barracks.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Day Room
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Soldier recreation, brief administrative meetings, and weapons cleaning station.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A spartan, large rectangular room dominated by long, heavy wooden tables used for meals, gambling, or maintenance. The air is slightly cleaner here than in the main corridor, thanks to a few high, grated windows that let in minimal light. A large, stone fireplace sits unused on the west wall.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: One of the large sleeping areas for the rank-and-file soldiers in the North Ward, adjacent to the Day Room.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters A
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A long, open room filled with tightly packed rows of simple wooden bunks and thin, worn straw mattresses. The air is warm and smells strongly of unwashed bodies and cheap spirits. Personal gear is haphazardly stored beneath the bunks and along the rough stone walls.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The main exterior working area of the Industrial/South Ward, adjacent to the massive structures housing the Blood Forge access systems.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Industrial Service Yard
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Loading/unloading of raw materials, staging heavy equipment, and external access to the underground forge.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This yard is covered in black soot and fine ash, constantly being swept but never clean. It is dominated by heavy machinery, iron rails sunk into the ground, and the immense, windowless walls of the surrounding industrial buildings. The roar of the forge can be felt as a low vibration in the stones.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large structure on the ground floor, housing the heavy machinery used to service the underground Blood Forge, including hoists and ventilation.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Forge Winch House
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Mechanical control center for the underground Bloodforge elevators and ventilation shafts.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A deafening, massive room dominated by winches, iron gears, and thick hemp ropes for the hoist system. A pervasive smell of coal smoke and hot oil fills the space. A deep shaft protected by iron railings drops away into the darkness, leading toward the Bloodforge.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: Small, secure, and hot room adjacent to the main winch house, used for manual operation and maintenance oversight.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Winch Control & Signal Room
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Secure control point for the Forge's hoist and communication center.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A cramped, steel-lined room with a large observation window overlooking the Winch House (CBSF-G-SW02). The air here is stale and hot, kept secure by heavy, bolted iron doors. It contains levers, communication tubes, and emergency brake controls for the main hoist.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The second large sleeping area for barracks soldiers, connected to the first quarters and leading to hygiene facilities.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters B
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: Similar to the adjacent quarters, this room is filled with rows of double-stacked wooden bunks, maximizing the number of troops housed. The air is slightly cooler here due to less human occupancy and a faint breeze through a high ventilation shaft. A small, locked supply closet is tucked into the far corner.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A small, heavily secured supply room dedicated to lubricants, thick ropes, and replacement parts for the Forge Winch House equipment.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Winch Maintenance Storage
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Secure storage for essential winch house spares and consumables.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This is a dim, oily room packed with coils of heavy rope, canisters of grease, and replacement iron cogs and chains. The walls are lined with iron shelving, and the air is thick with the smell of machine oil. A heavily bolted, iron-grated hatch in the floor provides vertical access to the lower storage levels.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large, paved outdoor area directly inside the castle's main eastern gate, serving as the central hub for the Southeast Outer Ward.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Southeast Mustering Yard
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: A gathering point for troops, a staging area for wagons, and primary access to the stables.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A vast, rough yard paved with dark, uneven cobblestones, slightly stained with oil and manure. High walls surround it, providing little sunlight, and the massive gatehouse dominates the east side. The air is dominated by the smells of horses and leather.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The main stable block in the Southeast Outer Ward, providing housing for most of the castle's mounts.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Main Stables
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Shelter and care for 60-80 horses and mounts.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A long, covered structure with thick wooden support beams and a high ceiling to allow ventilation. Thirty stalls line the walls, separated by rough-hewn timbers. The air is heavy with the smell of hay, horse sweat, and ammonia, though it is surprisingly well-maintained for a military stable.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A wide, covered area adjacent to the Mustering Yard, used for sheltering wagons and carts from the weather.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Wagon & Vehicle Shed
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Storage and minor repair for castle wagons, carts, and siege equipment parts.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This is essentially an open-sided lean-to against the north wall of the stables, providing cover for several heavy supply wagons and a few lightly armored ballista carts. Spare wheels, barrels, and long wooden beams are stacked messily against the stone wall. It opens directly to the yard for easy staging.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A small, contained room acting as a functional smithy adjacent to the stables and wagon shed for immediate repairs.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Farrier's Smithy
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Shoeing horses and conducting minor, quick repairs on equipment and tools.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This workshop is grimy and hot, illuminated primarily by the constant glow of a small stone forge nestled into the corner. An anvil sits centrally, surrounded by various iron tools, water buckets, and piles of coal. The scent of burnt metal and woodsmoke is strong here.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The third large sleeping area in the North Ward Barracks, providing further troop housing.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters C
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This quarter is a mirror of the others, fitted with rows of rough, uncomfortable double bunks and individual footlockers at the end of each bed frame. It is sparsely lit, relying on the door openings and a few sputtering wall torches. There's a faint metallic odor here, possibly from armor storage.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The final sleeping quarters in this section of the North Ward Barracks, leading toward the armory and central areas.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters D
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This rectangular room completes the row of sleeping quarters. Like the others, it is Spartan and functional, lined with tightly packed wooden bunks. A distinct cold draft blows from the heavily fortified door leading toward the armory, suggesting the security requirements are much higher in that direction.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A wide, central thoroughfare running through the South Industrial Ward, separating the winch facilities from the main central courtyard.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Industrial Access Hall
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Primary transport route for raw materials and finished goods to and from the Bloodforge area.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This enormous hall is paved with heavily worn stone, deeply scored by iron wheels and dragged materials. Massive stone columns support the ceiling far overhead, and the air is thick with the scent of coal smoke, hot metal, and blood-oil. A huge, perpetually raised portcullis leads out to the exterior western yards.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A heavily fortified storage chamber containing the castle's essential military equipment for the North Ward garrison.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: North Ward Armory
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Secure storage and distribution point for arms and armor.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This room is cold and very secure, built directly into the thick northern curtain wall. Heavy wooden racks hold hundreds of spears, swords, and shields, and the walls are lined with mannequins displaying standard Blood Forge armor. The air smells strongly of oil, polish, and stale metal.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A massive, cylindrical stone building housing the primary winches and machinery for lifting materials and blood up from the subterranean Bloodforge.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Bloodforge Winch House
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Housings for the hoists and winches that service the Bloodforge below.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This is a towering, cylindrical structure dominated by a central massive iron winch and thick ropes or chains disappearing into the floor. The noise here is deafening when the machinery is active, and the air is hot, smelling of burnt oil and metallic blood. Windows are high and narrow, letting in little light.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A hallway leading from the main industrial thoroughfare toward the Western curtain wall, granting access to storage and external loading areas.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: West Industrial Corridor
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Provide lateral movement and access between the Forge structures and the western yard.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This wide, rough-hewn corridor connects the main central industrial area to the west. It is marked by a pervasive layer of black soot and dust on the stone walls and floor. Iron hooks and loops embedded high in the ceiling suggest the passage of heavy, suspended loads.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large, mostly open yard where material is loaded and unloaded against the Western curtain wall, serving the industrial zone.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Industrial Loading Yard
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Exterior storage, staging, and material transfer point for the Bloodforge.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This is a wide, grimy yard next to the western curtain wall, constantly traversed by carts and burdened laborers. The ground is packed dirt mixed with slag and coal dust. Numerous crates, barrels, and mounds of raw materials awaiting processing are scattered throughout the open space.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: A secure, specialized storage room for processed metals, finished tools, and sensitive industrial goods, adjacent to the loading yard.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Processed Goods Storage
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Securely storing valuable finished metal components and weapons from the Bloodforge.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This rectangular room is cleaner than the adjacent yards, designed for long-term storage of materials. Sturdy wooden shelves line the stone walls, holding ingots of specialized metal and newly forged, unadorned weaponry wrapped in oilcloth. A single heavy lock secures the door to the yard.

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The vast, open courtyard immediately past the main East Gatehouse, leading directly toward the Central Keep.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Main East Courtyard
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Ceremonial space, mustering area, and primary path to the Central Keep.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This enormous open space is paved with dark, polished basalt stones, arranged in chilling geometric patterns. It stretches hundreds of feet in all directions, designed to intimidate and show power, with the massive Central Keep looming in the center. The only major feature is the long, straight path leading from the east gate to the keep's main entrance.

features.label: Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)

mesh_anchors.boundary_interface: The large, irregular yard located in the southeast corner, dedicated to logistical and gate operations.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Southeast Mustering Yard
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Staging area for patrols, wagon traffic, and overflow barracks mustering. The main outer ward space.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: This yard is a mix of packed dirt and loose cobblestones, showing heavy use by wagons and mounted troops. It is enclosed by the tall eastern curtain wall and several low-slung stable and shed buildings. The air is dominated by the smell of horses, leather, and manure, a common sound of mundane castle life.

proposals.question: A space named "Southeast Mustering Yard" already exists. Duplicate names will cause confusion. How should we resolve this?

accumulatedChunkResults.materials: The outer curtain walls and the core of the Central Keep are constructed from massive blocks of **dark, heavily reinforced basalt** quarried from the nearby mountains. Interior service structures (barracks, stables) use a mix of **grey granite** and **rough-sawn, blood-red stained oak**. Arcane and industrial areas feature extensive use of **riveted black iron**, **blood-steel ingots**, and smooth, dark **marble** for ritual surfaces.
accumulatedChunkResults.lighting_scheme: Exterior courtyards rely on **natural light** during the day, which is often harsh and necessitates the high eastern wall. Interior spaces primarily use **magical blood-braziers** emitting a deep, throbbing crimson glow, supplemented by iron-cased **oil lanterns** in service areas, and nearly **total darkness** in the deep storage and vampire residential zones.
accumulatedChunkResults.atmosphere: Castle Blood Forge feels overwhelmingly **heavy, cold, and oppressive**. The massive scale is dehumanizing, and the dark stone absorbs all natural light, casting long, unnatural shadows. A constant, low-frequency **thrumming** emanates from the industrial south and below ground, often carrying a faint, metallic odor of **blood and ozone**, reminding all inhabitants of the castle's true, dark purpose.

notable_npcs.name: Lady Erliza the Bloodsmith
notable_npcs.role: Mistress of the Castle, High Vampire

notable_npcs.name: Commander Varkos
notable_npcs.location: North Ward Barracks/Central Keep Main Hall

encounter_areas.description: A sudden ambush of guards and war-dogs when the party crosses the wide, open eastern courtyard.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Extremely exposed space. Guards (Ranged) will utilize the statues for cover. No cover for players. Use the long approach path to force a drawn-out charge or a retreat to the gatehouse/keep door.

encounter_areas.description: The central winch machinery jams, or a specific piece of equipment must be lowered/raised to proceed, requiring coordination and knowledge of the winch controls.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: The winch shaft (Radius 5ft) is a deadly environmental hazard. Requires an Intelligence or Strength (Athletics) check to operate under pressure, perhaps while being harassed by a small Blood Golem.

encounter_areas.description: A squad of Blood-Bound Guard is arming themselves in the armory before their patrol rotation.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Tight quarters, disadvantage for large weapons. Racks of weapons offer partial cover (AC +2). Focus fire on the guard operating the stairs access to prevent reinforcements from the wall walk.

secrets.description: A pressure plate hidden beneath a stack of 'rejected' ingots opens a stone chute leading down to Sub-Level 2 (Bloodforge Storage).
secrets.how_to_find: DC 17 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the slightly uneven floor tile beneath the stack; DC 15 Strength (Athletics) to move the heavy ingots.

secrets.description: A loose floorboard on the muster scaffold hides a signet ring and a coded message from a previous spy.
secrets.how_to_find: DC 14 Investigation check on the scaffold while guards are distracted or DC 12 check if the area is empty.

accumulatedChunkResults.history:
Castle Blood Forge was not built over centuries like most fortresses; it was raised in a single decade by Lady Erliza's magically accelerated labor force. Its unique, imposing architecture is a testament to her ruthless efficiency and dark magical power. The fortress was designed not to resist the siege engines of men, but to repel the divine light of the sun and contain the volatile alchemical and ritual processes happening beneath its foundations. It is often said that every stone laid was sealed with a drop of blood.

The original structure stood on the ruins of an ancient dwarven mine that Erliza co-opted for its rich iron veins. When she discovered the peculiar, sanguine qualities of the subterranean water and ore, the castle's purpose shifted. It became the seat of her new empire, dedicated to forging Blood-Steel and creating her terrible constructs. The towers and curtain walls serve as a massive, dark shell shielding the industrial core and the sensitive workings of the Bloodforge from prying eyes and the purifying sunlight.
accumulatedChunkResults.current_events: A massive, experimental construct‚ÄîThe **Iron Behemoth**‚Äîis currently being assembled on the lowest levels of the Bloodforge. The industrial zone on the surface is working at triple capacity, causing frequent accidents and the erratic, loud operation of the winches (CBSF-G-SW06). Commander Varkos is pushing his guards harder than ever, readying for an unknown, imminent deployment or invasion. Rumors of a **critical component** needed for the Behemoth's completion‚Äîperhaps a holy relic or a specific living sacrifice‚Äîare circulating among the thralls and guards.
adventure_hooks: The party is tasked by a local resistance group to disable the **Bloodforge Winch House (CBSF-G-SW06)**, cutting off the supply of ritual components to the underground levels.
A spy was recently caught leaving a coded message in the **Southeast Mustering Yard (CBSF-G-SE01)**. The party must infiltrate the yard, retrieve the code, and escape before the next patrol.

Lady Erliza requires the specific raw material contained in the **Processed Goods Storage (CBSF-G-SW09)** for the Iron Behemoth. A rival faction hires the party to steal the Blood-Steel Ingots before they can be used.

special_features: **Blood-Steel Construction:** Many doors and fixtures are made of Blood-Steel, which is resistant to radiant damage and dampens divine magic (imposing disadvantage on certain holy spells cast against the object).

**The Keep's Shadow:** The Central Keep is enchanted to project an unnatural gloom, causing all areas within 50 feet of its base (including the East Courtyard, CBSF-G-CE01) to count as dim light, even under direct sun.

**Winch Resonance:** The massive winch in CBSF-G-SW06 creates a low, resonant magical field. Creatures attempting to cast or maintain concentration on a spell within 20 feet of the main shaft have disadvantage on their concentration checks.

accumulatedChunkResults.cinematic_walkthrough:
The entry begins at the massive, shadowed **East Gatehouse**, guarded by grim-faced, iron-clad soldiers. Once through, the party steps onto the enormous **Main East Courtyard (CBSF-G-CE01)**. The space is vast and chilling, paved in dark basalt that drinks the light, making the clear day feel overcast. The sheer mass of the Keep dominates the western horizon, its towering stone face and spire an impossible feat of construction that seems to watch every step.

Moving south, the atmosphere abruptly shifts as you enter the busy, chaotic **Southeast Mustering Yard (CBSF-G-SE01)**. Here, the grim military aesthetic gives way to logistical grime. The loud whinnying of horses and the shouts of thralls hauling supplies replace the silence of the courtyard. Dust and manure coat the ground, and the immense eastern wall looms, its 70-foot height cutting off the sunrise. The party observes soldiers inspecting wagons near the tethering posts and a sergeant drilling new recruits on the wooden scaffold.

Venturing into the South Industrial Ward, the air grows thick with heat and the metallic tang of the Bloodforge. The **Winch House (CBSF-G-SW06)** is a terrifying sight: a soaring chamber where massive iron gears grind, turning a central spool that lowers colossal buckets into the earth. The whole building vibrates with the noise, and the deep red glow of the magical lighting makes the metallic blood smell feel palpable. The journey culminates as you press through the narrow **West Industrial Corridor (CBSF-G-SW07)**, eventually reaching the **Industrial Loading Yard (CBSF-G-SW08)**, where hoists and cranes stand ready, silhouetted against the western curtain wall, awaiting the next shipment of Blood-Steel from the depths.

accumulatedChunkResults.materials: The outer curtain walls and the core of the Central Keep are constructed from massive blocks of **dark, heavily reinforced basalt** quarried from the nearby mountains. Interior service structures (barracks, stables) use a mix of **grey granite** and **rough-sawn, blood-red stained oak**. Arcane and industrial areas feature extensive use of **riveted black iron**, **blood-steel ingots**, and smooth, dark **marble** for ritual surfaces.
accumulatedChunkResults.lighting_scheme: Exterior courtyards rely on **natural light** during the day, which is often harsh and necessitates the high eastern wall. Interior spaces primarily use **magical blood-braziers** emitting a deep, throbbing crimson glow, supplemented by iron-cased **oil lanterns** in service areas, and nearly **total darkness** in the deep storage and vampire residential zones.
accumulatedChunkResults.atmosphere: Castle Blood Forge feels overwhelmingly **heavy, cold, and oppressive**. The massive scale is dehumanizing, and the dark stone absorbs all natural light, casting long, unnatural shadows. A constant, low-frequency **thrumming** emanates from the industrial south and below ground, often carrying a faint, metallic odor of **blood and ozone**, reminding all inhabitants of the castle's true, dark purpose.

notable_npcs.name: Lady Erliza the Bloodsmith
notable_npcs.role: Mistress of the Castle, High Vampire

notable_npcs.name: Commander Varkos
notable_npcs.location: North Ward Barracks/Central Keep Main Hall

encounter_areas.description: A sudden ambush of guards and war-dogs when the party crosses the wide, open eastern courtyard.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Extremely exposed space. Guards (Ranged) will utilize the statues for cover. No cover for players. Use the long approach path to force a drawn-out charge or a retreat to the gatehouse/keep door.

encounter_areas.description: The central winch machinery jams, or a specific piece of equipment must be lowered/raised to proceed, requiring coordination and knowledge of the winch controls.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: The winch shaft (Radius 5ft) is a deadly environmental hazard. Requires an Intelligence or Strength (Athletics) check to operate under pressure, perhaps while being harassed by a small Blood Golem.

encounter_areas.description: A squad of Blood-Bound Guard is arming themselves in the armory before their patrol rotation.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Tight quarters, disadvantage for large weapons. Racks of weapons offer partial cover (AC +2). Focus fire on the guard operating the stairs access to prevent reinforcements from the wall walk.

secrets.description: A pressure plate hidden beneath a stack of 'rejected' ingots opens a stone chute leading down to Sub-Level 2 (Bloodforge Storage).
secrets.how_to_find: DC 17 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the slightly uneven floor tile beneath the stack; DC 15 Strength (Athletics) to move the heavy ingots.

secrets.description: A loose floorboard on the muster scaffold hides a signet ring and a coded message from a previous spy.
secrets.how_to_find: DC 14 Investigation check on the scaffold while guards are distracted or DC 12 check if the area is empty.

treasure_locations.item: 5 Potion of Superior Healing, 1 +1 shield embossed with the Blood Forge crest.
treasure_locations.security: Locked Iron Chest (DC 18 Thieves' Tools), guarded.

treasure_locations.item: 10 Ingots of unrefined Blood-Steel (worth 500 gp each to the right buyer).
treasure_locations.security: Stacked deep within the shelving, requires three DC 16 Strength (Athletics) checks to clear the access pathway.

special_features: **Blood-Steel Construction:** Many doors and fixtures are made of Blood-Steel, which is resistant to radiant damage and dampens divine magic (imposing disadvantage on certain holy spells cast against the object).

**The Keep's Shadow:** The Central Keep is enchanted to project an unnatural gloom, causing all areas within 50 feet of its base (including the East Courtyard, CBSF-G-CE01) to count as dim light, even under direct sun.

accumulatedChunkResults.cinematic_walkthrough:
The entry begins at the massive, shadowed **East Gatehouse**, guarded by grim-faced, iron-clad soldiers. Once through, the party steps onto the enormous **Main East Courtyard (CBSF-G-CE01)**. The space is vast and chilling, paved in dark basalt that drinks the light, making the clear day feel overcast. The sheer mass of the Keep dominates the western horizon, its towering stone face and spire an impossible feat of construction that seems to watch every step.

Moving south, the atmosphere abruptly shifts as you enter the busy, chaotic **Southeast Mustering Yard (CBSF-G-SE01)**. Here, the grim military aesthetic gives way to logistical grime. The loud whinnying of horses and the shouts of thralls hauling supplies replace the silence of the courtyard. Dust and manure coat the ground, and the immense eastern wall looms, its 70-foot height cutting off the sunrise. The party observes soldiers inspecting wagons near the tethering posts and a sergeant drilling new recruits on the wooden scaffold.

Venturing into the South Industrial Ward, the air grows thick with heat and the metallic tang of the Bloodforge. The **Winch House (CBSF-G-SW06)** is a terrifying sight: a soaring chamber where massive iron gears grind, turning a central spool that lowers colossal buckets into the earth. The whole building vibrates with the noise, and the deep red glow of the magical lighting makes the metallic blood smell feel palpable. The journey culminates as you press through the narrow **West Industrial Corridor (CBSF-G-SW07)**, eventually reaching the **Industrial Loading Yard (CBSF-G-SW08)**, where hoists and cranes stand ready, silhouetted against the western curtain wall, awaiting the next shipment of Blood-Steel from the depths.

accumulatedChunkResults.materials: The outer curtain walls and the core of the Central Keep are constructed from massive blocks of **dark, heavily reinforced basalt** quarried from the nearby mountains. Interior service structures (barracks, stables) use a mix of **grey granite** and **rough-sawn, blood-red stained oak**. Arcane and industrial areas feature extensive use of **riveted black iron**, **blood-steel ingots**, and smooth, dark **marble** for ritual surfaces.
accumulatedChunkResults.lighting_scheme: Exterior courtyards rely on **natural light** during the day, which is often harsh and necessitates the high eastern wall. Interior spaces primarily use **magical blood-braziers** emitting a deep, throbbing crimson glow, supplemented by iron-cased **oil lanterns** in service areas, and nearly **total darkness** in the deep storage and vampire residential zones.
accumulatedChunkResults.atmosphere: Castle Blood Forge feels overwhelmingly **heavy, cold, and oppressive**. The massive scale is dehumanizing, and the dark stone absorbs all natural light, casting long, unnatural shadows. A constant, low-frequency **thrumming** emanates from the industrial south and below ground, often carrying a faint, metallic odor of **blood and ozone**, reminding all inhabitants of the castle's true, dark purpose.

notable_npcs.name: Lady Erliza the Bloodsmith
notable_npcs.role: Mistress of the Castle, High Vampire

notable_npcs.name: Commander Varkos
notable_npcs.location: North Ward Barracks/Central Keep Main Hall

encounter_areas.description: A sudden ambush of guards and war-dogs when the party crosses the wide, open eastern courtyard.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Extremely exposed space. Guards (Ranged) will utilize the statues for cover. No cover for players. Use the long approach path to force a drawn-out charge or a retreat to the gatehouse/keep door.

encounter_areas.description: The central winch machinery jams, or a specific piece of equipment must be lowered/raised to proceed, requiring coordination and knowledge of the winch controls.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: The winch shaft (Radius 5ft) is a deadly environmental hazard. Requires an Intelligence or Strength (Athletics) check to operate under pressure, perhaps while being harassed by a small Blood Golem.

encounter_areas.description: A squad of Blood-Bound Guard is arming themselves in the armory before their patrol rotation.
encounter_areas.tactical_notes: Tight quarters, disadvantage for large weapons. Racks of weapons offer partial cover (AC +2). Focus fire on the guard operating the stairs access to prevent reinforcements from the wall walk.

secrets.description: A pressure plate hidden beneath a stack of 'rejected' ingots opens a stone chute leading down to Sub-Level 2 (Bloodforge Storage).
secrets.how_to_find: DC 17 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the slightly uneven floor tile beneath the stack; DC 15 Strength (Athletics) to move the heavy ingots.

secrets.description: A loose floorboard on the muster scaffold hides a signet ring and a coded message from a previous spy.
secrets.how_to_find: DC 14 Investigation check on the scaffold while guards are distracted or DC 12 check if the area is empty.

treasure_locations.item: 5 Potion of Superior Healing, 1 +1 shield embossed with the Blood Forge crest.
treasure_locations.security: Locked Iron Chest (DC 18 Thieves' Tools), guarded.

treasure_locations.item: 10 Ingots of unrefined Blood-Steel (worth 500 gp each to the right buyer).
treasure_locations.security: Stacked deep within the shelving, requires three DC 16 Strength (Athletics) checks to clear the access pathway.

accumulatedChunkResults.history:
Castle Blood Forge was not built over centuries like most fortresses; it was raised in a single decade by Lady Erliza's magically accelerated labor force. Its unique, imposing architecture is a testament to her ruthless efficiency and dark magical power. The fortress was designed not to resist the siege engines of men, but to repel the divine light of the sun and contain the volatile alchemical and ritual processes happening beneath its foundations. It is often said that every stone laid was sealed with a drop of blood.

The original structure stood on the ruins of an ancient dwarven mine that Erliza co-opted for its rich iron veins. When she discovered the peculiar, sanguine qualities of the subterranean water and ore, the castle's purpose shifted. It became the seat of her new empire, dedicated to forging Blood-Steel and creating her terrible constructs. The towers and curtain walls serve as a massive, dark shell shielding the industrial core and the sensitive workings of the Bloodforge from prying eyes and the purifying sunlight.

The industrial zone on the surface is working at triple capacity, causing frequent accidents and the erratic, loud operation of the winches (CBSF-G-SW06). Commander Varkos is pushing his guards harder than ever, readying for an unknown, imminent deployment or invasion. Rumors of a **critical component** needed for the Behemoth's completion‚Äîperhaps a holy relic or a specific living sacrifice‚Äîare circulating among the thralls and guards.

**The Keep's Shadow:** The Central Keep is enchanted to project an unnatural gloom, causing all areas within 50 feet of its base (including the East Courtyard, CBSF-G-CE01) to count as dim light, even under direct sun.

liveMapSpaces.name: East Grand Courtyard (East Gate Approach)
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary external access, ceremonial entry, and main approach to the Central Keep.
liveMapSpaces.description: This massive, rectangular courtyard is dominated by the tall, intimidating East Curtain Wall, which casts long shadows even during the day. The ground is packed dirt and dark, crushed stone, constantly churning from military and industrial traffic.

features.label: Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)

Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)

liveMapSpaces.name: Southeast Outer Ward (Mustering Yard)
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary staging area for traffic, stable access, and general mustering point for troops and wagon trains.
liveMapSpaces.description: A vast, rough courtyard covering 300 ft by 240 ft in the southeast corner of the castle. The ground is hard-packed dirt and gravel, constantly churned by wagon wheels and horse hooves. It is bordered by the East and South curtain walls, the Gatehouse, and the low-slung service buildings.

liveMapSpaces.name: East Wall Guard Tower Base
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary staging area and armory for guards covering the East Curtain Wall and controlling the gate mechanisms.
liveMapSpaces.description: A cramped, hexagonal chamber at the base of the nearest inner tower, built into the 70ft wall. It contains weapon racks and a simple winch mechanism for raising the gate's secondary portcullis. The air here is stale and dusty, filled with the scent of oil and iron.

liveMapSpaces.name: Southeast Stables and Blacksmith Annex
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housing for warhorses and draft animals, and mundane repair smithy.
liveMapSpaces.description: A long, single-story structure running along the southern edge of the Outer Ward, featuring dozens of heavy timber stalls capable of holding 60-80 horses. The attached annex houses a constantly working, heat-stained smithy for general repairs and shoeing.

liveMapSpaces.name: Wagon Shed and Siege Equipment Bay
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Storage and maintenance area for transport wagons and heavy siege equipment.
liveMapSpaces.description: A long, open-fronted shed with a heavy timber frame and dirt floor. It is currently filled with heavy transport carts and two large, ominously quiet siege engines covered in tarpaulins. The area is dominated by the smell of oiled wood and coal dust.

liveMapSpaces.name: Inner South Ward Passage (Main Artery)
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary, high-traffic arterial road connecting the Outer Ward to the Central Keep and the industrial areas.
liveMapSpaces.description: A very wide, straight, stone-paved road that runs west from the Outer Ward, serving as the main ground-level thoroughfare. The passage is bordered by the low service buildings of the Southeast Ward and the heavier construction of the Barracks and Industrial Zone.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Courtyard (South Ward)
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Training, drill, and leisure area for the castle's mortal garrison.
liveMapSpaces.description: A square, open yard paved with rough, dark cobblestones. This area is enclosed by the Barracks buildings and is perpetually noisy with the shouts of training soldiers and the clatter of weaponry. A large, worn circular stone dais sits near the center, used by commanders to oversee drills.

liveMapSpaces.name: Central Keep Entrance Hall
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary defensive, ceremonial, and distributional hub of the Keep.
liveMapSpaces.description: A vast, cold hall built of basalt and dark marble, featuring soaring 40-foot ceilings. Four massive arches open onto the exterior courtyards. The air is heavy and perpetually dim, lit by flickering iron-caged torches.

liveMapSpaces.name: Grand Stairwell Chamber
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary vertical transport for the Central Keep, leading to residential and noble areas.
liveMapSpaces.description: A high, narrow chamber that houses the massive, U-shaped grand staircase. The stairs themselves are made of smooth, dark wood inlaid with faint, crimson-glowing metallic veins. Caged torches provide the only light, casting long, distorted shadows on the stone walls.

liveMapSpaces.name: Southeast Mustering Yard & Stables Approach
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Logistics hub, staging ground for mounted troops, and area for non-arcane repair.
liveMapSpaces.description: A large, contained open space featuring stables, repair sheds, and a dirt-and-gravel yard for mustering troops and moving supplies. It is notably grimier and louder than the main courtyard, dominated by the smell of horses and hot iron.

liveMapSpaces.name: North Ward Main Corridor
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Internal movement artery, primary access to barracks and administrative offices.
liveMapSpaces.description: A long, dimly lit corridor running parallel to the north wall, smelling faintly of stale sweat and lamp oil. The stone walls are heavily scarred and lined with large, simple wooden doors leading into the barracks rooms. This corridor is designed for efficient, large-scale troop movement.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Day Room
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Soldier recreation, brief administrative meetings, and weapons cleaning station.
liveMapSpaces.description: A spartan, large rectangular room dominated by long, heavy wooden tables used for meals, gambling, or maintenance. The air is slightly cleaner here than in the main corridor, thanks to a few high, grated windows that let in minimal light. A large, stone fireplace sits unused on the west wall.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters A
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
liveMapSpaces.description: A long, open room filled with tightly packed rows of simple wooden bunks and thin, worn straw mattresses. The air is warm and smells strongly of unwashed bodies and cheap spirits. Personal gear is haphazardly stored beneath the bunks and along the rough stone walls.

liveMapSpaces.name: Industrial Service Yard
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Loading/unloading of raw materials, staging heavy equipment, and external access to the underground forge.
liveMapSpaces.description: This yard is covered in black soot and fine ash, constantly being swept but never clean. It is dominated by heavy machinery, iron rails sunk into the ground, and the immense, windowless walls of the surrounding industrial buildings. The roar of the forge can be felt as a low vibration in the stones.

liveMapSpaces.name: Forge Winch House
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Mechanical control center for the underground Bloodforge elevators and ventilation shafts.
liveMapSpaces.description: A deafening, massive room dominated by winches, iron gears, and thick hemp ropes for the hoist system. A pervasive smell of coal smoke and hot oil fills the space. A deep shaft protected by iron railings drops away into the darkness, leading toward the Bloodforge.

liveMapSpaces.name: Winch Control & Signal Room
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Secure control point for the Forge's hoist and communication center.
liveMapSpaces.description: A cramped, steel-lined room with a large observation window overlooking the Winch House (CBSF-G-SW02). The air here is stale and hot, kept secure by heavy, bolted iron doors. It contains levers, communication tubes, and emergency brake controls for the main hoist.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters B
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
liveMapSpaces.description: Similar to the adjacent quarters, this room is filled with rows of double-stacked wooden bunks, maximizing the number of troops housed. The air is slightly cooler here due to less human occupancy and a faint breeze through a high ventilation shaft. A small, locked supply closet is tucked into the far corner.

liveMapSpaces.name: Winch Maintenance Storage
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Secure storage for essential winch house spares and consumables.
liveMapSpaces.description: This is a dim, oily room packed with coils of heavy rope, canisters of grease, and replacement iron cogs and chains. The walls are lined with iron shelving, and the air is thick with the smell of machine oil. A heavily bolted, iron-grated hatch in the floor provides vertical access to the lower storage levels.

liveMapSpaces.name: Southeast Mustering Yard
liveMapSpaces.purpose: A gathering point for troops, a staging area for wagons, and primary access to the stables.
liveMapSpaces.description: A vast, rough yard paved with dark, uneven cobblestones, slightly stained with oil and manure. High walls surround it, providing little sunlight, and the massive gatehouse dominates the east side. The air is dominated by the smells of horses and leather.

liveMapSpaces.name: Main Stables
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Shelter and care for 60-80 horses and mounts.
liveMapSpaces.description: A long, covered structure with thick wooden support beams and a high ceiling to allow ventilation. Thirty stalls line the walls, separated by rough-hewn timbers. The air is heavy with the smell of hay, horse sweat, and ammonia, though it is surprisingly well-maintained for a military stable.

liveMapSpaces.name: Wagon & Vehicle Shed
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Storage and minor repair for castle wagons, carts, and siege equipment parts.
liveMapSpaces.description: This is essentially an open-sided lean-to against the north wall of the stables, providing cover for several heavy supply wagons and a few lightly armored ballista carts. Spare wheels, barrels, and long wooden beams are stacked messily against the stone wall. It opens directly to the yard for easy staging.

liveMapSpaces.name: Farrier's Smithy
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Shoeing horses and conducting minor, quick repairs on equipment and tools.
liveMapSpaces.description: This workshop is grimy and hot, illuminated primarily by the constant glow of a small stone forge nestled into the corner. An anvil sits centrally, surrounded by various iron tools, water buckets, and piles of coal. The scent of burnt metal and woodsmoke is strong here.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters C
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
liveMapSpaces.description: This quarter is a mirror of the others, fitted with rows of rough, uncomfortable double bunks and individual footlockers at the end of each bed frame. It is sparsely lit, relying on the door openings and a few sputtering wall torches. There's a faint metallic odor here, possibly from armor storage.

liveMapSpaces.name: Barracks Sleeping Quarters D
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housing for 30-40 soldiers.
liveMapSpaces.description: This rectangular room completes the row of sleeping quarters. Like the others, it is Spartan and functional, lined with tightly packed wooden bunks. A distinct cold draft blows from the heavily fortified door leading toward the armory, suggesting the security requirements are much higher in that direction.

liveMapSpaces.name: Industrial Access Hall
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Primary transport route for raw materials and finished goods to and from the Bloodforge area.
liveMapSpaces.description: This enormous hall is paved with heavily worn stone, deeply scored by iron wheels and dragged materials. Massive stone columns support the ceiling far overhead, and the air is thick with the scent of coal smoke, hot metal, and blood-oil. A huge, perpetually raised portcullis leads out to the exterior western yards.

liveMapSpaces.name: North Ward Armory
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Secure storage and distribution point for arms and armor.
liveMapSpaces.description: This room is cold and very secure, built directly into the thick northern curtain wall. Heavy wooden racks hold hundreds of spears, swords, and shields, and the walls are lined with mannequins displaying standard Blood Forge armor. The air smells strongly of oil, polish, and stale metal.

liveMapSpaces.name: Bloodforge Winch House
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Housings for the hoists and winches that service the Bloodforge below.
liveMapSpaces.description: This is a towering, cylindrical structure dominated by a central massive iron winch and thick ropes or chains disappearing into the floor. The noise here is deafening when the machinery is active, and the air is hot, smelling of burnt oil and metallic blood. Windows are high and narrow, letting in little light.

liveMapSpaces.name: West Industrial Corridor
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Provide lateral movement and access between the Forge structures and the western yard.
liveMapSpaces.description: This wide, rough-hewn corridor connects the main central industrial area to the west. It is marked by a pervasive layer of black soot and dust on the stone walls and floor. Iron hooks and loops embedded high in the ceiling suggest the passage of heavy, suspended loads.

liveMapSpaces.name: Industrial Loading Yard
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Exterior storage, staging, and material transfer point for the Bloodforge.
liveMapSpaces.description: This is a wide, grimy yard next to the western curtain wall, constantly traversed by carts and burdened laborers. The ground is packed dirt mixed with slag and coal dust. Numerous crates, barrels, and mounds of raw materials awaiting processing are scattered throughout the open space.

liveMapSpaces.name: Processed Goods Storage
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Securely storing valuable finished metal components and weapons from the Bloodforge.
liveMapSpaces.description: This rectangular room is cleaner than the adjacent yards, designed for long-term storage of materials. Sturdy wooden shelves line the stone walls, holding ingots of specialized metal and newly forged, unadorned weaponry wrapped in oilcloth. A single heavy lock secures the door to the yard.

liveMapSpaces.name: Main East Courtyard
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Ceremonial space, mustering area, and primary path to the Central Keep.
liveMapSpaces.description: This enormous open space is paved with dark, polished basalt stones, arranged in chilling geometric patterns. It stretches hundreds of feet in all directions, designed to intimidate and show power, with the massive Central Keep looming in the center. The only major feature is the long, straight path leading from the east gate to the keep's main entrance.

features.label: Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)
Large Granite Statues of Bat-Winged Figures (Pair)

liveMapSpaces.name: Southeast Mustering Yard
liveMapSpaces.purpose: Staging area for patrols, wagon traffic, and overflow barracks mustering. The main outer ward space.
liveMapSpaces.description: This yard is a mix of packed dirt and loose cobblestones, showing heavy use by wagons and mounted troops. It is enclosed by the tall eastern curtain wall and several low-slung stable and shed buildings. The air is dominated by the smell of horses, leather, and manure, a common sound of mundane castle life.
